keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The president said that while the gunman appeared to have been inspired by extremist information online, there was no clear evidence he was part of a wider terrorist plot.

headline.print_headline: Obama Calls Attack a Case of Homegrown Extremism
headline.main: Obama Says Orlando Gunman Was Probably a Homegrown Extremist

snippet: The president said that while the gunman appeared to have been inspired by extremist information online, there was no clear evidence he was part of a wider terrorist plot.
abstract: Pres Obama says Omar Mateen, gunman who killed 49 people in Orlando, Fla, nightclub, professed loyalty to Islamic State but had no direct connection to it and did not appear to be part of wider plot by group; laments easy accessibility of both Islamic State propaganda and powerful weapons to troubled individuals.
